definition[0]: if a bird or insect flutters, or if it flutters its wings, it flies by moving its wings lightly up and down
example[0]: A small bird fluttered past the window.
definition[1]: to make small gentle movements in the air
example[1]: Dead leaves fluttered slowly to the ground.
example[2]: The flag fluttered in the light breeze.
definition[2]: if your heart or your stomach flutters, you feel very excited or nervous
definition[3]: if your eyelids flutter, they move slightly when you are asleep
example[3]: Her eyelids fluttered but did not open.
definition[4]: a feeling of being nervous, confused, or excited
example[4]: His sudden resignation caused quite a flutter.
example[5]: She was all in a flutter.
definition[6]: to risk a small amount of money on the result of a horse race, football game etc
example[7]: Lots of people like to have a flutter on the lottery.
